Class MancalaGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • MancalaGame

  • public final class MancalaGame
extends java.lang.Object
    An implementation of the Mancala game using two arrays to hold both player's pits.
    Author:
    Jeremy Asuncion

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_INITIAL_STONES
      The maximum amount of initial stones allowed for each pit.
      static int MAX_PITS
      The maximum amount of pits in a game.
      static int MAX_PLAYERS
      The maximum amount of players allowed in a game.
      static int MIN_INITIAL_STONES
      The minimum amount of initial stones allowed for each pit.
      static int PLAYER_A
      An integer constant representing player A.
      static int PLAYER_B
      An integer constant representing player B.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MancalaGame()
      Constructs a new Mancala game using the default pit stone count, 3.
      MancalaGame(int initialStones)
      Constructs a new Mancala game with initialStones stones filled in each pit.

      • addChangeListenerToPit

        public void addChangeListenerToPit(int player,
                                   int position,
                                   javax.swing.event.ChangeListener listener)
        Adds a change listener to the specified player's pit.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to attach a listener to
        position - The position of the pit
        listener - The listener

      • clearListeners

        public void clearListeners()
        Clears all listeners for both Mancalas and pits

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public int getCurrentPlayer()
        Returns the current player.
        Returns:
        The current player.

      • getWinningPlayer

        public int getWinningPlayer()
        Returns the winning player. Returns -1 if the game is still going and no one has won.
        Returns:
        The winning player, or -1 if no one has won

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Returns true if the game is over, false if not.
        Returns:
        True if game over, false if not

      • selectPit

        public void selectPit(int position)
        Selects a pit for the current player at the specified position, and distributes the stones according to the rules of the Mancala game.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the pit. The value should be within 0 <= position < 6
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the position is not within 0 <= position < 6
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the game is over or if there is a pending commit

      • commitLastSelection

        public void commitLastSelection()
        Commits the last selection to the pit data models. After this method is called, the listeners of the data models are invoked.

        When the game data is committed to the models, the game checks for a winner. If there is a winner, getWinningPlayer() will return a positive value (Either PLAYER_A or PLAYER_B), and further calls to any commands will cause RuntimeExceptions

        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the game is over or if there is no pending commit

      • undoLastSelection

        public void undoLastSelection()
        Undos the last selection if the undo is available. Returns if the undo was successful. This call will return false if the game is over, if there is no pending commit, or if there is no undo available.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the game is already over, if there is no pending commit, or if there is no undo available
